title: Three Men in Ahmaud Arbery Killing Charged With Federal Hate Crimes
sub_head: Black joggerâ€™s shooting death in Georgia in 2020 sparked outcry; three white defendants have pleaded not guilty to state murder charges
body:
Three white men have been indicted on federal hate crimes charges in the killing of Ahmaud Arbery, a 25-year-old Black man who was fatally shot in February 2020 while out jogging in southeast Georgia, the Justice Department said Wednesday.
A federal grand jury indicted Gregory McMichael, who is 65 years old, his son, Travis McMichael, 35, and William Bryan Jr., 51, in connection with the killing, which sparked a nationwide outcry after a video of the shooting spread online months later. The men have also been also charged at the state level with murder and other crimes. They have all pleaded not guilty to those charges.
More to follow.
